channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024030355
item.description:
Report X-2024030355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE PACKAGE WAS BEING UNLOADED PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED BOX WAS WET AND PUT THE PACKAGE IN A HAZMAT TOTE. THEN BROUGHT PACKAGE TO QA FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. DescribePack: CAP WAS LOOSE TO PRODUCT CAUSING CONTENTS TO LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE HANDLER PLACE PACKAGE IN A HAZMAT TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA. THEN QA BROUGHT PACKAGE TO HAZMAT CAGE AND PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT DRUM FOR FURTER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024030326
item.description:
Report X-2024030326

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS DISCOVERS FISHER SCIENTIFIC ACTETIC ACID, GLARICAL 20 LITERS PLASTIC DRUM HAD A LEAK THAT APPEARED TO BE CAUSED BY A SPILT IN THE SEEM OF THE DRUM UNDER THE DRUM HANDLE. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS DISCOVERED SPECTRUM HEPTANES 4 X 4 LITERS IN GLASS BOTTLES. ONE OF THE BOTTLES BROKE AND 100 % SPILLAGE. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024030145
item.description:
Report X-2024030145

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: PARSIPPANY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CONTENTS OF A NEXT DAY AIR PACKAGE WERE INSPECTED DUE TO THE OUTER BOX BEING MARKED AS FROZEN BAKED GOODS AND BEING COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY EIGHT POUNDS OF DRY ICE BLOCKS COOLING FROZEN BAKED GOODS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THERE IS A YELLOW THERM-O-CHILL OVERNITE SHIPPERS POLAR TECH INDUSTRIES INC STICKER APPLIED. OUTER BOX IS A THERMO CHILL INSULATED SHIPPERS BOX PREPRINTED RUSH AND PERISHABLE WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024030384
item.description:
Report X-2024030384

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection showed package to be wet from internal leakage, and fiberboard box is mostly lost or destroyed. Damage most likely caused from being dropped or mishandled. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2024030194
item.description:
Report X-2024030194

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During sort package leaking white paint. On inspection, identified one of two inner cans of paint was bent significantly enough to force lid to open and cause leak. Additionally paint is a hazmat however it was shipped undeclared with no hazmat decal markings. DescribePack: Paint can bent causing paint to leak throughout box. No inner packing used to minimize shipping impact DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: once identified, package was separated from other sort packages and placed in a hazmat bag in bin for further processing.

item.title: Report E-2024030152
item.description:
Report E-2024030152

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: WESTAMPTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When loading pallet that had the jerricans into the trailer it was noticed that one of the jerricans was slightly leaking from the bottom. Further investigation revealed that a nail protruding from the pallet had slightly punctured the bottom of the jerrican contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured jerrican.

item.title: Report X-2024030149
item.description:
Report X-2024030149

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: TRENTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: SIL-ACT ATS-42 5Gal Jerrican abraded another object causing cap to become loose. Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing. DescribePack: SIL-ACT ATS-42 5Gal Jerrican abraded another object causing cap to become loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2024030010
item.description:
Report X-2024030010

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: LAWNSIDE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE FELL FROM BELT. UPS RESPONDER WORE REQUIRED PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT, PLUS SILVER SHIELD LINERS. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DESCISION TREE. THE PACKAGE WAS GENERATING SMOKE. HE NOTIFIED THE RMP WHO STARTED THE CHAIN OF COMMAND. THE CORPORATE ENVIRONMENTAL COORDINATIOR WAS NOTIFIED AND CONTACTED HAZMAT ONE.

item.title: Report E-2024030168
item.description:
Report E-2024030168

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: VINELAND
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 ounces of hydroxyethyl acrylate (UN2922) was released from a 55 gal DF due to a broken pallet. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS with the terminal and it was determined that terminal personnel were Not capable of cleaning the release. The consignee did conduct their own cleanups and neutralizing of the product before overpacking it and returning it to the XPO terminal for disposal. (1) 85 gallon DF contains product only was sent to the waste area and managed by the terminal.

  • Description: When loading pallet of jerricans into trailer material handler observed one of the jerricans slightly leaking. Further investigation revealed that a nail protruding from the pallet the jerrican was staged on had punctured the bottom of the jerrican contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured jerrican.
